See also: Anrufen

German[edit]

Etymology[edit]

From rufen (“to shout”).

Pronunciation[edit]

  • IPA(key): [ˈʔanʁuːfɱ̩], [ˈʔanʁuːfən]
  • Audio (Austria)
    		(file)
  • Audio
    		(file)

Verb[edit]

anrufen (class 7 strong, third-person singular simple present ruft an, past tense rief an, past participle angerufen, past subjunctive riefe an, auxiliary haben)

  1. (transitive) to call by telephone; to ring (someone)
  2. (transitive) to call on (someone, e.g. a divine being); to appeal to; to call upon
